seed.haxe_doc: * A random seed used to generated particles. * Provide a custom seed to reproduce same chain of particles.

getCustomParticleVisual.haxe_doc: * Custom particle visual creation. Use this to emit custom visuals as particle. Another option * is to create a subclass of `ParticleEmitter` and override `getParticleVisual()` method.

_quantityToEmit.haxe_doc: * The internal quantity we want to emit (when emitting continuously)

_activeParticles.haxe_doc: * Internal list of active particle items

_recycledParticles.haxe_doc: * Internal list of recycled particle items

_updatingParticles.haxe_doc: * Internal list of particle items when they are being iterated on to be updated

update.haxe_doc: * Called automatically by the game loop

emitContinuousParticlesIfNeeded.haxe_doc: * Emit one or more particles if continuous emission is active and enough time has passed

updateParticle.haxe_doc: * Update a particle (and its visual) from its parameter and elapsed time

createParticleItem.haxe_doc: * Instanciate and return a new ParticleItem object. * Override this method if you want to instanciate a custom ParticleItem subclass * @return ParticleItem

getParticleVisual.haxe_doc: * Get a visual for a particle that will be emitted right after. * If a visual is being recycled, provide it as argument.

recycleParticleVisual.haxe_doc: * Recycle a particle's visual to reuse it later.

emitContinuously.haxe_doc: * Start emitting particles continuously. * * @param interval How often to emit a particle. * `0` = never emit, `0.1` = 1 particle every 0.1 seconds, `5` = 1 particle every 5 seconds. * @param quantity How many particles to launch before stopping. `-1` (default) = never stop

explode.haxe_doc: * Burst a given quantity number of particles at once * * @param quantity How many particles to launch. Does nothing if lower than `1`

emitParticle.haxe_doc: * This function can be used both internally and externally to emit the next particle.

class.haxe_doc: * A particle emitter.

time.haxe_doc: * The time relative to app when this particule was emitted

random.haxe_doc: * Convenience: hold a random value between 0 and 1 for each particle

status.haxe_doc: * In case implementation needs to keep a status for each particle, this property can be used for that

class.haxe_doc: * A particle item. * You should not instanciate this yourself as * it is managed by a `Particles` emitter object.

emitterPaused.haxe_doc: * Determines whether the emitter is currently paused. It is totally safe to directly toggle this.

emitterInterval.haxe_doc: * How often a particle is emitted, if currently emitting. * Can be modified at the middle of an emission safely;

emitterLaunchMode.haxe_doc: * How particles should be launched. If `CIRCLE` (default), particles will use `launchAngle` and `speed`. * Otherwise, particles will just use `velocityX` and `velocityY`.

emitterIgnoreAngularVelocity.haxe_doc: * Set this if you want to specify the beginning and ending value of angle, * instead of using `angularVelocity` (or `angularAcceleration`).

emitterSize.haxe_doc: * The width and height of the emission area. * If not defined (`-1`), will use visual's width and height bound to this `ParticleEmitter` object, if any

emitterPos.haxe_doc: * The x and y position of the emission, relative to particles parent (if any)

emitterMaxVelocity.haxe_doc: * If you are using `acceleration`, you can use `maxVelocity` with it * to cap the speed automatically (very useful!).

emitterVelocityStart.haxe_doc: * Sets the velocity starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end. Only used with `SQUARE`.

emitterVelocityEnd.haxe_doc: * Sets the velocity ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end. Only used with `SQUARE`.

emitterSpeedStart.haxe_doc: * Set the speed starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end. Only used with `CIRCLE`.

emitterSpeedEnd.haxe_doc: * Set the speed ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end. Only used with `CIRCLE`.

emitterAngularAcceleration.haxe_doc: * Set the angular acceleration range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAngularDrag.haxe_doc: * Set the angular drag range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAngularVelocityStart.haxe_doc: * The angular velocity starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAngularVelocityEnd.haxe_doc: * The angular velocity ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAngleStart.haxe_doc: * The angle starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end. * `angleEndMin` and `angleEndMax` are ignored unless `ignoreAngularVelocity` is set to `true`.

emitterAngleEnd.haxe_doc: * The angle ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end. * `angleEndMin` and `angleEndMax` are ignored unless `ignoreAngularVelocity` is set to `true`.

emitterLaunchAngle.haxe_doc: * The angle range at which particles will be launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end. * Ignored unless `launchMode` is set to `CIRCLE`.

emitterLifespan.haxe_doc: * The life, or duration, range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterScaleStart.haxe_doc: * Sets `scale` starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterScaleEnd.haxe_doc: * Sets `scale` ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAccelerationStart.haxe_doc: * Sets `acceleration` starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAccelerationEnd.haxe_doc: * Sets `acceleration` ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterDragStart.haxe_doc: * Sets `drag` starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterdragEnd.haxe_doc: * Sets `drag` ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterColorStart.haxe_doc: * Sets `color` starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterColorEnd.haxe_doc: * Sets `color` ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAlphaStart.haxe_doc: * Sets `alpha` starting range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

emitterAlphaEnd.haxe_doc: * Sets `alpha` ending range of particles launched from this #if cs (cast emitter:ParticleEmitter) #else emitter #end.

CIRCLE.haxe_doc: * Particles will use `launchAngle` and `speed` to be launched

SQUARE.haxe_doc: * Particles will use `velocityX` and `velocityY` to be launched

enum.haxe_doc: * How particles should be launched. If `CIRCLE`, particles will use `launchAngle` and `speed`. * Otherwise, particles will just use `velocityX` and `velocityY`.

IDLE.haxe_doc: * Not emitting particles, and no particle is visible.

SPREADING.haxe_doc: * Not emitting particles, but previously emitted particles are still spreading

enum.haxe_doc: * Which status a `Particles` emitter object has.

withoutExtension.haxe_doc:
Returns the String representation of `path` without the file extension.
If `path` is null, the result is unspecified.

withoutDirectory.haxe_doc:
Returns the String representation of `path` without the directory.
If `path` is null, the result is unspecified.

directory.haxe_doc:
Returns the directory of `path`.
If the directory is null, the empty String `""` is returned.
If `path` is null, the result is unspecified.

extension.haxe_doc:
Returns the extension of `path`.
If the extension is null, the empty String `""` is returned.
If `path` is null, the result is unspecified.

withExtension.haxe_doc:
Returns a String representation of `path` where the extension is `ext`.
If `path` has no extension, `ext` is added as extension.
If `path` or `ext` are null, the result is unspecified.

join.haxe_doc:
Joins all paths in `paths` together.
If `paths` is empty, the empty String `""` is returned. Otherwise the paths are joined with a slash between them.
If `paths` is null, the result is unspecified.

normalize.haxe_doc:
Normalize a given `path` (e.g. make '/usr/local/../lib' to '/usr/lib').
Also replaces backslashes \ with slashes / and afterwards turns multiple slashes into a single one.
If `path` is null, the result is unspecified.

addTrailingSlash.haxe_doc:
Adds a trailing slash to `path`, if it does not have one already.
If the last slash in `path` is a backslash, a backslash is appended to `path`.
If the last slash in `path` is a slash, or if no slash is found, a slash is appended to `path`. In particular, this applies to the empty String `""`.
If `path` is null, the result is unspecified.

removeTrailingSlashes.haxe_doc:
Removes trailing slashes from `path`.
If `path` does not end with a `/` or `\`, `path` is returned unchanged.
Otherwise the substring of `path` excluding the trailing slashes or backslashes is returned.
If `path` is null, the result is unspecified.

isAbsolute.haxe_doc: Returns true if the path is an absolute path, and false otherwise.

dir.haxe_doc:
The directory.
This is the leading part of the path that is not part of the file name and the extension.
Does not end with a `/` or `\` separator.
If the path has no directory, the value is null.

file.haxe_doc:
The file name.
This is the part of the part between the directory and the extension.
If there is no file name, e.g. for ".htaccess" or "/dir/", the value is the empty String "".

ext.haxe_doc:
The file extension.
It is separated from the file name by a dot. This dot is not part of the extension.
If the path has no extension, the value is null.

backslash.haxe_doc: True if the last directory separator is a backslash, false otherwise.

toString.haxe_doc:
Returns a String representation of `this` path.
If `this.backslash` is true, backslash is used as directory separator, otherwise slash is used. This only affects the separator between `this.dir` and `this.file`.
If `this.directory` or `this.extension` is null, their representation is the empty String "".

new.haxe_doc:
Creates a new Path instance by parsing `path`.
Path information can be retrieved by accessing the dir, file and ext properties.

class.haxe_doc:
This class provides a convenient way of working with paths. It supports the common path formats:
- directory1/directory2/filename.extension - directory1\directory2\filename.extension

sharpness.haxe_doc: * Sharpness of the pixels (from 1.0 to above)

gridThickness.haxe_doc: * If set above 0.0, a grid will be displayed. * Can be used to simulate GBA-style LCD displays.

gridColor.haxe_doc: * When using a grid, this is the color of the grid

gridAlpha.haxe_doc: * When using a grid, this is the alpha of the grid

class.haxe_doc: * A filter configured to display pixel art content. * Uses a shader to get a nicer rendering of upscaled pixel art. * Better than NEAREST or LINEAR texture filtering. * (see https://colececil.io/blog/2017/scaling-pixel-art-without-destroying-it/)

m.e: { copyAlpha : true, copyBlue : true, copyGreen : true, copyRed : true }

copy.haxe_doc: * Copy pixels from `srcBuffer` to `dstBuffer` * @param srcBuffer Source buffer to copy pixels from * @param srcBufferWidth Source buffer image width (needed to know index from x,y coordinates) * @param dstBuffer Destination buffer to past pixels into * @param dstBufferWidth Destination buffer image width (needed to know index from x,y coordinates) * @param srcX Source x position to copy from * @param srcY Source y position to copy from * @param srcWidth Source width to copy from * @param srcHeight Source height to copy from * @param dstX Destination x to paste into * @param dstY Destination y to paste into * @param copyRed Set to `true` default to copy red channel * @param copyGreen Set to `true` default to copy green channel * @param copyBlue Set to `true` default to copy blue channel * @param copyAlpha Set to `true` default to copy alpha channel

create.haxe_doc: * Create a pixels buffer * @param width Image width * @param height Image height * @param fillColor Default color * @return UInt8Array

fromBytes.haxe_doc: * Create a pixels buffer from bytes with RGBA representation

get.haxe_doc: * Get a pixel as `AlphaColor` at `x`,`y` coordinates on the given buffer * @param buffer The pixel buffer to read from * @param bufferWidth Image width * @param x Pixel x position * @param y Pixel y position * @return AlphaColor

set.haxe_doc: * Set a pixel as `AlphaColor` at `x`,`y` coordinates on the given buffer * @param buffer The pixel buffer to write into * @param bufferWidth Image width * @param x Pixel x position * @param y Pixel y position * @param color AlphaColor of the pixel

setRectangle.haxe_doc: * Set a rectangle of pixels as `AlphaColor` at `x`,`y` coordinates and with the specified `width` and `height` on the given buffer * @param buffer The pixel buffer to write into * @param bufferWidth Image width * @param x Rectangle x position * @param y Rectangle y position * @param width Rectangle width * @param height Rectangle height * @param color AlphaColor of the rectangle's pixels

pixelsToPng.haxe_doc: * Export the given pixels pixels as PNG data and save it to the given file path * @param width Image width * @param height Image height * @param pixels The pixels buffer * @param path The png file path where to save the image (`'/path/to/image.png'`) * @param done Called when the png has been exported

* Export the given pixels to PNG data/bytes * @param width Image width * @param height Image height * @param pixels The pixels buffer * @param done Called when the png has been exported, with `data` containing PNG bytes * @return ->Void):Void

rgbaPixelsToRgbPixels.haxe_doc: * Converts a RGBA pixels buffer into RGB pixels buffer * @param width Image width * @param height Image height * @param inPixels The source RGBA pixels buffer * @param outPixels (optional) The destination RGB pixels buffer * @return The final RGB pixels buffer

rgbPixelsToRgbaPixels.haxe_doc: * Converts a RGB pixels buffer into RGBA pixels buffer * @param width Image width * @param height Image height * @param alpha Alpha value (0-255) to use (default to 255) * @param inPixels The source RGBA pixels buffer * @param outPixels (optional) The destination RGB pixels buffer * @return The final RGBA pixels buffer

mixPixelsBuffers.haxe_doc: * Mix the given list of pixels buffers into a single one. * @param inPixelsList An array of pixels buffers * @param middleFactor A multiplicator that makes the middle buffers more important than the rest if above 1 * @param outPixels (optional) The destination pixels buffer * @return The final mixed pixels buffer

flipY.haxe_doc: * Flip the given pixels buffer on the Y axis * @param buffer The pixel buffer to read from and write to * @param bufferWidth Image width

flipX.haxe_doc: * Flip the given pixels buffer on the X axis * @param buffer The pixel buffer to read from and write to * @param bufferWidth Image width

class.haxe_doc: * Utilities to manipulate RGBA pixels.

readStringFromAsset.haxe_doc: * Read a string from an asset file, synchronously. * Warning: not available on every targets * @return String

readBytesFromAsset.haxe_doc: * Read bytes from an asset file, synchronously. * Warning: not available on every targets * @return String

getAssetsPath.haxe_doc: * Returns assets paths on disk (if any) * Warning: not available on every targets * @return String

class.haxe_doc: * An internal class that encapsulate platform-specific code. * We usually want platform-specific code to be located in a backend, * but it may happen that sometimes creating a backend interface is overkill. * That's where this comes handy.

abstract.haxe_doc:
`ReadOnlyArray` is an abstract over an ordinary `Array` which only exposes APIs that don't modify the instance, hence "read-only".
Note that this doesn't necessarily mean that the instance is *immutable*. Other code holding a reference to the underlying `Array` can still modify it, and the reference can be obtained with a `cast`.

original.haxe_doc: * Returns the underlying (and mutable) data. Use at your own risk!
* Returns the underlying (and mutable) data. Use at your own risk!
* Returns the underlying (and mutable) data. Use at your own risk!
* Returns the underlying (and mutable) data. Use at your own risk!

fromPixels.haxe_doc: * Create a new texture from the given pixels buffer * @param width Width of the texture * @param height Height of the texture * @param pixels A pixel buffer in integer RGBA format * @param density (optional) density of the texture * @return Texture

fromBytes.haxe_doc: * Create a new texture from the given bytes. * The bytes must be PNG or JPEG data * @param bytes The PNG or JPEG data as bytes * @param density (optional) Density of the texture * @param options (optional) Additional options when loading texture (could depend on backend) * @param done A callback receiving the loaded texture, or `null` if it failed

textureId.haxe_doc: * The texture ID used by the underlying backend (OpenGL etc...)

nativeWidth.haxe_doc: * The native width of the texture, not depending on texture density

nativeHeight.haxe_doc: * The native height of the texture, not depending on texture density

nativeWidthActual.haxe_doc: * The native actual width of the texture. * Same as native width unless underlying backend needs pot (power of two) sizes.

nativeHeightActual.haxe_doc: * The native actual height of the texture. * Same as native height unless underlying backend needs pot (power of two) sizes.

setWrap.haxe_doc: * Shorthand for setting both wrapS and wrapT at the same time. * Possible values: `CLAMP`, `REPEAT`, `MIRROR` * @param wrapS horizontal wrap mode * @param wrapT vertical wrap mode

toPng.haxe_doc: * Export texture as PNG data and save it to the given file path * @param path The png file path where to save the image (`'/path/to/image.png'`) * @param done Called when the png has been exported
* Export texture to PNG data/bytes * @param done Called when the png has been exported, with `data` containing PNG bytes

class.haxe_doc: * A texture is an image ready to be drawn.

stamp.haxe_doc: * Draws the given visual onto the render texture. * The drawing operation is not done synchronously. * It waits for the next draw stage of the app to perform it, * then calls done() when finished. * This is expected to be used with a texture `autoRender` set to `false`.

m.e: { clipHeight : -1, clipWidth : -1, clipY : -1, clipX : -1, alpha : 0, color : 0xFFFFFF }

clear.haxe_doc: * Clears the texture, or a specific area of it with a fill color and alpha. * The drawing operation is not done synchronously. * It waits for the next draw stage of the app to perform it, * then calls done() when finished. * This is expected to be used with a texture `autoRender` set to `false`.

m.e: { antialiasing : 0, stencil : true, depth : true, density : -1 }

drawMesh.haxe_doc: Using an inline internal function because we want to use similar code multiple times, and let haxe compiler evaluate `hasCustomAttributes` and `hasTextureSlot` at compile time.

class.haxe_doc: * An implementation-independant GPU 2D renderer. * To be used in pair with a draw backend implementation.
* A reusable array to use in places that need a temporary array many times. * Changing array size only increases the backing array size but never decreases it.

currentIsMainThread.haxe_doc: * Returns `true` if current running thread is main thread * @return Bool

init.haxe_doc: * Call this on your thread to make primary, * the calling thread will be used for callbacks.

tick.haxe_doc: * Call this on the primary manually, * Returns the number of callbacks called.

isEmulatingBackgroundWithMain.haxe_doc: * Returns `true` if _running in background_ is emulated on this platform by * running _background_ code in main thread instead of using background thread.

runInMain.haxe_doc: * Call a function on the primary thread without waiting or blocking. * If you want return values see runInMainBlocking

runInBackground.haxe_doc: * Create a background thread using the given function, or just run (deferred) the function if threads are not supported

class.haxe_doc:
A simple Haxe class for easily running threads and calling functions on the primary thread. from https://github.com/underscorediscovery/
Usage: - call Runner.init() from your primary thread - call Runner.tick() periodically to service callbacks (i.e inside your main loop) - use Runner.thread(function() { ... }) to make a thread - use Runner.runInMainThread(function() { ... }) to run code on the main thread - use runInMainThreadBlocking to run code on the main thread and wait for the return value

getEncodableLists.haxe_doc: * Same as getLists(), but will transform Maps into JSON-encodable raw objects.

class.haxe_doc: * Runtime utilities to compute asset lists/names from raw (relative) file list. * Code is very similar to AssetsMacro, but for runtime execution, with any list of asset.

name.haxe_doc: * Convert a scanCode to a readable name

_dox_event_observedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

emitObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

onObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

onceObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

offObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

listensObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

observedDirty.haxe_doc: Default is `false`, automatically set to `true` when any of this instance's observable variables has changed.

isRootScene.haxe_doc: * Whether this scene is a root scene

autoUpdate.haxe_doc: * Set to `false` if you want to disable auto update on this scene object. * If auto update is disabled, you become responsible to explicitly call * `update(delta)` at every frame yourself. Use this if you want to have control over * when the animation update is actually happening. Don't use it to pause animation. * (animation can be paused with `paused` property instead)

autoUpdateWhenInactive.haxe_doc: * If `autoUpdate` is enabled, setting `autoUpdateWhenInactive` to `true` * will keep updating the scene even when inactive.

preload.haxe_doc: * Override this method to configure the scene, add assets to it... * example: `assets.add(Images.SOME_IMAGE);` * Added assets will be loaded automatically

load.haxe_doc: * Override this method to perform any additional asynchronous loading. * `next()` must be called once the loading has finished so that the scene * can continue its createialization process. * @param next The callback to call once asynchronous loading is done

create.haxe_doc: * Called once the scene has finished its loading. * At this point, and after `create()`, `update(delta)` will be called at every frame until the scene gets destroyed

ready.haxe_doc: * Called when the scene's status becomes `READY`

update.haxe_doc: * Called at every frame, but only after create() has been called and when the scene is not paused * @param delta

resize.haxe_doc: * Called if the scene size has been changed during this frame. * @param width new width * @param height new height

fadeIn.haxe_doc: * Play **fade-in** transition of this scene. This is automatically called right after * the scene is ready to use, meaning after `create()` has been called. * Default implementation does nothing and calls `done()` right away. * Override in subclasses to perform custom transitions. * @param done Called when the fade-in transition has finished.

fadeOut.haxe_doc: * Play **fade-out** transition of this scene. This is called manually on secondary scene * but will be called automatically if the scene is the **main scene** and is replaced * by a new scene or simply removed. * @param done Called when the fade-out transition has finished.

NONE.haxe_doc: * No status. The scene is likely not assigned to anything.

PRELOAD.haxe_doc: * The scene is calling the `preload()` method. * That happens when the scene is added as root scene or is added as a child of another visual.

LOAD.haxe_doc: * The scene is actually loading. Any asset that was * added with `assets.add()` in the `preload()` method is * getting loaded.

CREATE.haxe_doc: * The scene has finished loading and is calling the `create()` method * to fill it with any object, visual needed etc...

FADE_IN.haxe_doc: * The `create()` method has finished running so the scene is now ready to **fade in**. * Default fade in implementation is _instant_, but this can be changed by overriding * the `fadeIn()` method.

READY.haxe_doc: * When **fade in** has finished, the scene is marked as **ready**.

FADE_OUT.haxe_doc: * The scene begins to **fade out**, likely because it was explicitly asked to do so, * or is being replaced by another scene.

DISABLED.haxe_doc: * Happens after **fade out**. When the scene has this status, it should not be used anymore.

NONE.haxe_doc: * No status. The scene is likely not assigned to anything.

PRELOAD.haxe_doc: * The scene is calling the `preload()` method. * That happens when the scene is added as root scene or is added as a child of another visual.

LOAD.haxe_doc: * The scene is actually loading. Any asset that was * added with `assets.add()` in the `preload()` method is * getting loaded.

CREATE.haxe_doc: * The scene has finished loading and is calling the `create()` method * to fill it with any object, visual needed etc...

FADE_IN.haxe_doc: * The `create()` method has finished running so the scene is now ready to **fade in**. * Default fade in implementation is _instant_, but this can be changed by overriding * the `fadeIn()` method.

READY.haxe_doc: * When **fade in** has finished, the scene is marked as **ready**.

FADE_OUT.haxe_doc: * The scene begins to **fade out**, likely because it was explicitly asked to do so, * or is being replaced by another scene.

DISABLED.haxe_doc: * Happens after **fade out**. When the scene has this status, it should not be used anymore.

listensBeginEarlyUpdate.haxe_doc: Does it listen to beginEarlyUpdate event

listensEndEarlyUpdate.haxe_doc: Does it listen to endEarlyUpdate event

listensBeginLateUpdate.haxe_doc: Does it listen to beginLateUpdate event

listensEndLateUpdate.haxe_doc: Does it listen to endLateUpdate event

name.haxe_doc: * System name. * Useful to retrieve a system afterwards

autoUpdate.haxe_doc: * When set to `true` (default). This system will be updated automatically. * If `false`, you'll need to call `earlyUpdate()` and `lateUpdate()` manually.

earlyUpdateOrder.haxe_doc: * Order of earlyUpdate execution. * Given two systems, a system with a lower `earlyUpdateOrder` value will have * it's `earlyUpdate()` method called before another system's `earlyUpdate()` * method with a higher `order` value.

lateUpdateOrder.haxe_doc: * Order of lateUpdate execution. * Given two systems, a system with a lower `lateUpdateOrder` value will have * it's `lateUpdate()` method called before another system's `lateUpdate()` * method with a higher `order` value.

earlyUpdate.haxe_doc: * Method automatically called right before app's `update` event * @param delta

lateUpdate.haxe_doc: * Method automatically called right before app's right after `update` event * @param delta

class.haxe_doc: * A `System` is an object assigned to app lifecycle and used to * do some work such as dispatching events or manipulating entities. * Systems can be ordered with `order` properties

keepAssetsForNextMain.haxe_doc: * If `true`, when assigning a new main scene, assets of the previous * main scene will be kept instead of being destroyed and can be * reused by the new main scene without having to reload these

bindMainToScreenSize.haxe_doc: * If `true`, main scene will be bound to screen size automatically

fadeOutWhenNextMainCanFadeIn.haxe_doc: * If `true`, when assigning a new main scene, previous main * scene will wait until the next scene is properly loaded and can fade-in * before starting its own fade-out transition.

main.haxe_doc: * The main scene to display on screen.

autoDestroyFilter.haxe_doc: * If set to `true` (default), any filter assigned to the system will be destroyed * if replaced by another filter, set to null, or if the system is destroyed.

autoScaleFilter.haxe_doc: * If set to `true` (default), a filter assigned to the system will * be auto-scaled to fit screen size.

filter.haxe_doc: * Assign a filter to the scene system, that will be used to render root scenes

set.haxe_doc: * Assign secondary scenes to display them directly on screen. * @param name The slot name of the scene * @param scene The scene to assign * @param bindToScreenSize (optional) Set to `false` if you don't want the scene to follow screen size * @param keepAssets * (optional) Set to `true` if you want this scene to keep the same **assets** * instance as the previous scene on the same slot.

get.haxe_doc: * Retrieve a secondary scene from the given slot name * @param name The slot name of the scene to retrieve * @return A `Scene` instance or `null` if nothing was found

class.haxe_doc: * System managing scenes display and lifecycle. * Use it to structure your app in different scenes.

matchedHitVisual.haxe_doc: * Internal reference to a matched hit visual. This is used to let Visual.hit() return `false` * on every visual not related to the matched hit visual, if any is defined.

_dox_event_observedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

emitObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

onObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

onceObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

offObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

listensObservedDirty.haxe_doc: Event when any observable value as changed on this instance.

observedDirty.haxe_doc: Default is `false`, automatically set to `true` when any of this instance's observable variables has changed.

density.haxe_doc: * Screen density computed from app's logical width/height * settings and native width/height.

width.haxe_doc: * Logical width used in app to position elements. * Updated when the screen is resized.

height.haxe_doc: * Logical height used in app to position elements. * Updated when the screen is resized.

actualWidth.haxe_doc: * The actual width available on screen, including offsets, in the same unit as `width`. * Updated when the screen is resized.

actualHeight.haxe_doc: * The actual height available on screen, including offsets, in the same unit as `width`. * Updated when the screen is resized.

offsetX.haxe_doc: * Logical x offset. * Updated when the screen is resized.

offsetY.haxe_doc: * Logical y offset. * Updated when the screen is resized.

pointerX.haxe_doc: * Pointer x coordinate, computed from mouse and touch events. * When using multiple touch inputs at the same time, x will be * the mean value of all touches x value. Use this as a * convenience when you don't want to deal with multiple positions.

pointerY.haxe_doc: * Pointer y coordinate, computed from mouse and touch events. * When using multiple touch inputs at the same time, y will be * the mean value of all touches y value. Use this as a * convenience when you don't want to deal with multiple positions.

pointerDeltaX.haxe_doc: * Pointer x delta since last frame

pointerDeltaY.haxe_doc: * Pointer y delta since last frame

mouseX.haxe_doc: * Mouse x coordinate, computed from mouse events.

mouseY.haxe_doc: * Mouse y coordinate, computed from mouse events.

mouseDeltaX.haxe_doc: * Mouse x delta since last frame

mouseDeltaY.haxe_doc: * Mouse y delta since last frame

mouseWheelDeltaX.haxe_doc: * Mouse wheel x delta since last frame

mouseWheelDeltaY.haxe_doc: * Mouse wheel y delta since last frame

touches.haxe_doc: * Touches x and y coordinates by touch index.

texturesDensity.haxe_doc: * Ideal textures density, computed from settings * targetDensity and current screen state.

matrix.haxe_doc: * Root matrix applied to every visual. * This is recomputed on screen resize but * can be changed otherwise.

reverseMatrix.haxe_doc: * Internal inverted matrix computed from root matrix.

resizing.haxe_doc: * In order to prevent nested resizes.

isPointerDown.haxe_doc: * Whether the screen is between a `pointer down` and an `pointer up` event or not.

_dox_event_resize.haxe_doc: * Resize event occurs once at startup, then each time any * of native width, height or density changes.

emitResize.haxe_doc: * Resize event occurs once at startup, then each time any * of native width, height or density changes.

onResize.haxe_doc: * Resize event occurs once at startup, then each time any * of native width, height or density changes.

onceResize.haxe_doc: * Resize event occurs once at startup, then each time any * of native width, height or density changes.

offResize.haxe_doc: * Resize event occurs once at startup, then each time any * of native width, height or density changes.

listensResize.haxe_doc: * Resize event occurs once at startup, then each time any * of native width, height or density changes.

listensMouseDown.haxe_doc: Does it listen to mouseDown event

listensMouseUp.haxe_doc: Does it listen to mouseUp event

listensMouseWheel.haxe_doc: Does it listen to mouseWheel event

listensMouseMove.haxe_doc: Does it listen to mouseMove event

listensTouchDown.haxe_doc: Does it listen to touchDown event

listensTouchUp.haxe_doc: Does it listen to touchUp event

listensTouchMove.haxe_doc: Does it listen to touchMove event

listensPointerDown.haxe_doc: Does it listen to pointerDown event

listensPointerUp.haxe_doc: Does it listen to pointerUp event

listensPointerMove.haxe_doc: Does it listen to pointerMove event

listensMultiTouchPointerDown.haxe_doc: Does it listen to multiTouchPointerDown event

listensMultiTouchPointerUp.haxe_doc: Does it listen to multiTouchPointerUp event

listensMultiTouchPointerMove.haxe_doc: Does it listen to multiTouchPointerMove event

listensFocus.haxe_doc: Does it listen to focus event

listensBlur.haxe_doc: Does it listen to blur event

updateScaling.haxe_doc: * Recompute screen width, height and density from settings and native state.

updateTransform.haxe_doc: * Recompute transform from screen width, height and density.

mouseAllowed.haxe_doc: * Return `true` if mouse events are currently allowed for the given owner. * This is only useful on very specific cases.

FIT.haxe_doc: * Screen width and height match target size in settings. * Result is scaled to fit into native screen bounds.

FILL.haxe_doc: * Screen width and height match target size in settings. * Result is scaled to fill native screen area.

RESIZE.haxe_doc: * Screen width and height are automatically resized * to exactly match native screen size.

FIT_RESIZE.haxe_doc: * Either width or height is increased so that aspect ratio * becomes the same as as native screen's aspect ratio. * Result is scaled to fit exactly into native screen bounds.

class.haxe_doc: * For now, just a way to identify a script module as a type, to resolve fields dynamically from scripts. * Might be extended later to link with "script converted to haxe compiled code"

toHscript.haxe_doc: * Converts the given `inScript` to hscript. * This will take care of transforming a few idioms borrowed from js/ts to hscript equivalent. * @param inScript * @return String

listensDragStart.haxe_doc: Does it listen to dragStart event

listensDragEnd.haxe_doc: Does it listen to dragEnd event

listensWheelStart.haxe_doc: Does it listen to wheelStart event

listensWheelEnd.haxe_doc: Does it listen to wheelEnd event

listensClick.haxe_doc: Does it listen to click event

listensScrollerPointerDown.haxe_doc: Does it listen to scrollerPointerDown event

listensScrollerPointerUp.haxe_doc: Does it listen to scrollerPointerUp event

roundScrollWhenIdle.haxe_doc: * If set to a value above zero, scrollX and scrollY will be rounded when scroller is idle. * * ```haxe * roundScrollWhenIdle = 0; // No rounding (default) * roundScrollWhenIdle = 1; // Pixel perfect rounding * roundScrollWhenIdle = 2; // Half-pixel rounding * ```

verticalToHorizontalWheel.haxe_doc: * When set to `true`, vertical mouse wheel event * will also work on horizontal scroller.

TOUCHING.haxe_doc: * Being touched, but not dragging yet

DRAGGING.haxe_doc: * Being dragged by a touch/mouse event

reset.haxe_doc: * Reset the initial value to that of the current seed.

class.haxe_doc: * Seeded random number generator to get reproducible sequences of values.

targetWidth.haxe_doc: * Target width. Affects window size at startup (unless `windowWidth` is specified) * and affects screen scaling at any time. * Ignored if set to 0 (default)

targetHeight.haxe_doc: * Target height. Affects window size at startup (unless `windowHeight` is specified) * and affects screen scaling at any time. * Ignored if set to 0 (default)

targetSize.haxe_doc: * Target width and height. Affects window size at startup * and affects screen scaling at any time. * Ignored if set to 0 (default) * @param targetWidth Target width * @param targetHeight Target height

windowWidth.haxe_doc: * Target window width at startup * Uses `targetWidth` as fallback if set to 0 (default)

windowHeight.haxe_doc: * Target window height at startup * Uses `targetHeight` as fallback if set to 0 (default)

targetDensity.haxe_doc: * Target density. Affects the quality of textures * being loaded. Changing it at runtime will update * texture quality if needed. * Ignored if set to 0 (default)

scaling.haxe_doc: * Screen scaling (FIT, FILL, RESIZE or FIT_RESIZE).

targetFps.haxe_doc: * Target FPS. Using default FPS if value < 1 or try to match the given value if >= 1.

maxDelta.haxe_doc: * Maximum app update delta time. * During app update (at each frame), `app.delta` will be capped to `maxDelta` * if its value is above `maxDelta`. * If needed, use `app.realDelta` to get real elapsed time since last frame.

overrideDelta.haxe_doc: * Override app update delta time. * This can be used to ignore completely the actual elapsed time between frames * and replace it with an explicit delta time of your choice. * This will affect timers, tween, systems update etc... * Use with caution.

preventDefaultMouseWheel.haxe_doc: * If set to `true` (default). Default mouse wheel events * will be prevented. This is relevant when running the ceramic * app from an `iframe` inside a page that can scroll.

preventDefaultTouches.haxe_doc: * If set to `true` (default). Default touch events * will be prevented. This is relevant when running the ceramic * app from an `iframe` inside a page that can scroll, * on a touchscreen device.

orientation.haxe_doc: * Setup screen orientation. Default is `NONE`, * meaning nothing is enforced and project defaults will be used.

appInfo.haxe_doc: * App info (useful when dynamically loaded, not needed otherwise).

resizable.haxe_doc: * Whether the window can be resized or not.

fromSource.haxe_doc: * Instanciates a shader from source. * Although it would expect `GLSL` code in default ceramic backends (luxe backend), * Expected shading language could be different in some future backend implementations.

points.haxe_doc: * A flat array of vertex coordinates to describe the shape. * `points = ...` is identical to `vertices = ... ; contentDirty = true ;` * Note: when editing array content without reassigning it, * `contentDirty` must be set to `true` to let the shape being updated accordingly.

holes.haxe_doc: * An array of hole indices, if any. * (e.g. `[5, 8]` for a 12-vertex input would mean * one hole with vertices 5–7 and another with 8–11). * Note: when editing array content without reassigning it, * `contentDirty` must be set to `true` to let the shape being updated accordingly.

autoComputeSize.haxe_doc: * If set to `true`, width and heigh will be computed from shape points.

class.haxe_doc: * Draw shapes by triangulating vertices automatically, with optional holes in it.

m.e: { implicitSize : true, highlight : { points : "points", minPoints : 3, maxPoints : 999999999 }, disable : ["texture", "vertices", "indices", "uvs"] }

unobserve.haxe_doc: * Ensures current `autorun` won't be affected by the code after this call. * `reobserve()` should be called to restore previous state.

reobserve.haxe_doc: * Resume observing values and resume affecting current `autorun` scope. * This should be called after an `unobserve()` call.

class.haxe_doc: * Shortcuts adds convenience identifiers to access ceramic app, screen, ... * Use it by adding `import ceramic.Shortcuts.*;` in your files.

sort.haxe_doc:
Sorts Array `a` according to the comparison function `cmp`, where `cmp(x,y)` returns 0 if `x == y`, a positive Int if `x > y` and a negative Int if `x < y`.
This operation modifies Array `a` in place.
This operation is stable: The order of equal elements is preserved.
If `a` or `cmp` are null, the result is unspecified.

class.haxe_doc:
SortVisuals provides a stable implementation of merge sort through its `sort` method. It should be used instead of `Array.sort` in cases where the order of equal elements has to be retained on all targets.
This specific implementation has been modified to be exclusively used with array of `ceramic.Visual` instances. The compare function (and the rest of the implementation) are inlined to get the best performance out of it.

sort.haxe_doc:
Sorts Array `a` according to the comparison function `cmp`, where `cmp(x,y)` returns 0 if `x == y`, a positive Int if `x > y` and a negative Int if `x < y`.
This operation modifies Array `a` in place.
This operation is stable: The order of equal elements is preserved.
If `a` or `cmp` are null, the result is unspecified.

class.haxe_doc:
SortVisuals provides a stable implementation of merge sort through its `sort` method. It should be used instead of `Array.sort` in cases where the order of equal elements has to be retained on all targets.
This specific implementation has been modified to be exclusively used with array of `ceramic.Visual` instances and sort them by depth. The compare function (and the rest of the implementation) are inlined to get the best performance out of it.

volume.haxe_doc: * Default volume when playing this sound.

pan.haxe_doc: * Default pan when playing this sound.

pitch.haxe_doc: * Default pitch when playing this sound.

play.haxe_doc: * Play the sound at requested position. If volume/pan/pitch are not provided, * sound instance properties will be used instead.

listensReplaceSound.haxe_doc: Does it listen to replaceSound event

volume.haxe_doc: * The volume of the sound being played.

pan.haxe_doc: * The pan of the sound being played.

pitch.haxe_doc: * The pitch of the sound being played.

position.haxe_doc: * The position (in seconds) of the sound being played.

pan.haxe_doc: * The pan of the sound being played.

pitch.haxe_doc: * The pitch of the sound being played.

position.haxe_doc: * The position (in seconds) of the sound being played.

NO_STATE.haxe_doc: * A way to assign null state to generic classes and let final target do what is best as a cast

paused.haxe_doc: * When set to `true`, the state machine will stop calling `update()` on current state and related.

autoUpdate.haxe_doc: * When set to `true` (default). This state machine will be updated automatically. * If `false`, you'll need to call `update()` manually.

stateDefined.haxe_doc: * Is `true` if a state has been assigned, `false` otherwise.

nextStateDefined.haxe_doc: * Is `true` if a nextState has been assigned, `false` otherwise.

locked.haxe_doc: * If set to `true`, changing state will be forbidden and trigger an error.

nextState.haxe_doc: * When transitioning from one state to another, * this will be set to the next incoming state

earlyUpdateOrderDirty.haxe_doc: * If `true`, `earlyUpdateOrdered` list needs to be sorted

lateUpdateOrderDirty.haxe_doc: * If `true`, `lateUpdateOrdered` list needs to be sorted

earlyUpdateOrdered.haxe_doc: * List of systems, ordered ascending according to their `earlyUpdateOrder` property

lateUpdateOrdered.haxe_doc: * List of systems, ordered ascending according to their `lateUpdateOrder` property

_udpatingSystems.haxe_doc: * Internal pre-allocated array used for iteration

listensDone.haxe_doc: Does it listen to done event

listensFail.haxe_doc: Does it listen to fail event

listensGlyphQuadsChange.haxe_doc: Does it listen to glyphQuadsChange event

fitWidth.haxe_doc: * If set to `true`, text will be displayed with line breaks * as needed so that it fits in the requested width.

lineForYPosition.haxe_doc: * Get the line number matching the given `y` position. * `y` is relative this `Text` visual.

posInLineForX.haxe_doc: * Get the character index position relative to `line` at the requested `x` value. * `x` is relative this `Text` visual.

indexForPosInLine.haxe_doc: * Get the _global_ character index from the given `line` and `posInLine` index position relative to `line`

xPositionAtIndex.haxe_doc: * Get an `x` position from the given character `index`. * `x` is relative to this `Text` visual.

lineForIndex.haxe_doc: * Get the line number (starting from zero) of the character at the given `index`

posInLineForIndex.haxe_doc: * Get a character index position relative to its line from its _global_ `index` position.

class.haxe_doc: * A visual to layout and display text. * Works with UTF-8 strings.

listensUpdate.haxe_doc: Does it listen to update event

listensEnter.haxe_doc: Does it listen to enter event

listensEscape.haxe_doc: Does it listen to escape event

listensStop.haxe_doc: Does it listen to stop event

m.e: { delegate : null, allowMovingCursor : false, selectionEnd : -1, selectionStart : -1, multiline : false }

posInCurrentLine.haxe_doc: * Get the position in the current line, from the given global position in text

lineForPos.haxe_doc: * Get the current line (starts from 0) from the given global position in text

regions.haxe_doc: * The texture regions of this atlas

asset.haxe_doc: * The asset related to this atlas (if any)

computeFrames.haxe_doc: * Expected to be called when every page got their texture loaded, * in order to compute the actual frames of each region

listensFinishPack.haxe_doc: Does it listen to finishPack event

add.haxe_doc: * Add a region to this atlas packer that is a variant of * another existing region: it has the same packed size in pixels * but can have different offsets and original size.

pack.haxe_doc: * Pack new regions added with `add()` to the texture atlas. * If no texture atlas exists yet, it will be created.

originalWidth.haxe_doc: * Original region width (including margins / transparent pixels)

originalHeight.haxe_doc: * Original region height (including margins / transparent pixels)

packedWidth.haxe_doc: * Packed region width (without margins / transparent pixels)

packedHeight.haxe_doc: * Packed region height (without margins / transparent pixels)

offsetX.haxe_doc: * X offset to position the region to its original size

offsetY.haxe_doc: * Y offset to position the region to its original size

pixels.haxe_doc: * If the region comes from a pixels buffer, this is the buffer

sourceRegion.haxe_doc: * If the region is a variant of another region, * this is the other region used as source

rect.haxe_doc: * The rect describing how this region should be packed

rendered.haxe_doc: * Whether this region has been rendered to a page texture or not

class.haxe_doc: * A region for a texture atlas packer. Not to be confused * with `TextureAtlasRegion` which is to be used with `TextureAtlas`, * while `TextureAtlasPackerRegion` is holding information to * pack a region with `TextureAtlasPacker` and is not a region * usable with an atlas yet.

readTuple.haxe_doc: Returns the number of tuple values read (1, 2 or 4).

edgeInset.haxe_doc: * When assigning the file to a quad, edge uvs will be adjusted by this inset. * Can be useful to set it to values like `0.5` in some situations like * preventing atlas regions from displaying bleed from siblings.

packedWidth.haxe_doc: * Width in actual pixels after rotation (if any)

packedHeight.haxe_doc: * Height in actual pixels after rotation (if any)

class.haxe_doc: * A texture atlas region is part of a texture atlas. * It is also a `TextureTile` subclass so that it can be assigned * to `Quad`'s `tile` property.
* Incremental texture tile packer that allows to alloc, release and reuse tiles as needed.

col.haxe_doc: * The column index of this tile

row.haxe_doc: * The row index of this tile

usedCols.haxe_doc: * The number of column blocks used by this packed texture tile (starting from column index)

usedRows.haxe_doc: * The number of row blocks used by this packed texture tile (starting from row index)

class.haxe_doc: * Private class used internally to store additional texture tile data.

emitEndLabel.haxe_doc: * Triggered when position reaches the end of an area following the given label. * Either when a new label was reached or when end of timeline was reached * @param index label index (position) * @param name label name

onEndLabel.haxe_doc: * Triggered when position reaches the end of an area following the given label. * Either when a new label was reached or when end of timeline was reached * @param index label index (position) * @param name label name

offEndLabel.haxe_doc: * Triggered when position reaches the end of an area following the given label. * Either when a new label was reached or when end of timeline was reached * @param index label index (position) * @param name label name

listensEndLabel.haxe_doc: * Triggered when position reaches the end of an area following the given label. * Either when a new label was reached or when end of timeline was reached * @param index label index (position) * @param name label name

size.haxe_doc: * Timeline size. Default `0`, meaning this timeline won't do anything. * By default, because `autoFitSize` is `true`, adding or updating tracks on this * timeline will update timeline `size` accordingly so it may not be needed to update `size` explicitly. * Setting `size` to `-1` means the timeline will never finish.

autoFitSize.haxe_doc: * If set to `true` (default), adding or updating tracks on this timeline will update * timeline size accordingly to match longest track size.

loop.haxe_doc: * Whether this timeline should loop. Ignored if timeline's `size` is `-1` (not defined).

autoUpdate.haxe_doc: * Whether this timeline should bind itself to update cycle automatically or not (default `true`).

fps.haxe_doc: * Frames per second on this timeline. * Note: a lower fps doesn't mean animations won't be interpolated between frames. * Thus using 30 fps is still fine even if screen refreshes at 60 fps.

position.haxe_doc: * Position on this timeline. * Gets back to zero when `loop=true` and position reaches a defined `size`.

tracks.haxe_doc: * The tracks updated by this timeline

paused.haxe_doc: * Whether this timeline is paused or not.

labels.haxe_doc: * Used in pair with `labelIndexes` to manage timeline labels

labelIndexes.haxe_doc: * Used in pair with `labels` to manage timeline labels

startPosition.haxe_doc: * If >= 0, timeline will start from this index. * When timeline is looping, it will reset to this index as well at each iteration.

endPosition.haxe_doc: * If provided, timeline will stop at this index. * When timeline is looping, it will reset to startIndex (if >= 0).

completeHandlerIndexes.haxe_doc: * Internal array of complete handler label indexes

bindOrUnbindUpdateIfNeeded.haxe_doc: * Internal function to bind or update to app * update event depending on current settings

seek.haxe_doc: * Seek the given position (in frames) in the timeline. * Will take care of clamping `position` or looping it depending on `size` and `loop` properties.

animate.haxe_doc: * Animate starting from the given label name and calls complete when * reaching the end of label area (= when animation finishes). * If animation is interrupted (by playing another animation, seeking another position...), * complete won't be called. * @param name Label name * @param complete callback fired when animation finishes.

seekLabel.haxe_doc: * Seek position to match the given label * @param name Label name * @return The index (position) of the looping label, or -1 if no label was found

loopLabel.haxe_doc: * Seek position to match the given label and set startPosition and endPosition * so that it will loop through the whole area following this label, up to the * position of the next label or the end of the timeline. * @param name Label name * @return The index (position) of the looping label, or -1 if no label was found

apply.haxe_doc: * Apply (or re-apply) every track of this timeline at the current position

add.haxe_doc: * Add a track to this timeline

remove.haxe_doc: * Remove a track from this timeline

fitSize.haxe_doc: * Update `size` property to make it fit * the size of the longuest track.

size.haxe_doc: * Track size. Default `0`, meaning this track won't do anything. * By default, because `autoFitSize` is `true`, adding new keyframes to this * track will update `size` accordingly so it may not be needed to update `size` explicitly. * Setting `size` to `-1` means the track will never finish.

autoFitSize.haxe_doc: * If set to `true` (default), adding keyframes to this track will update * its size accordingly to match last keyframe time.

loop.haxe_doc: * Whether this track should loop. Ignored if track's `size` is `-1` (not defined).

locked.haxe_doc: * Whether this track is locked or not. * A locked track doesn't get updated by the timeline it is attached to, if any.

timeline.haxe_doc: * Timeline on which this track is added to

position.haxe_doc: * Position on this track. * Gets back to zero when `loop=true` and position reaches a defined `size`.

keyframes.haxe_doc: * The key frames on this track.

before.haxe_doc: * The keyframe right before or equal to current time, if any.

after.haxe_doc: * The keyframe right after current time, if any.

keyframeBeforeIndex.haxe_doc: * The index of the last resolved `key index before`. Used internally.

keyframeAfterIndex.haxe_doc: * The index of the last resolved `key index after`. Used internally.

seek.haxe_doc: * Seek the given position (in frames) in the track. * Will take care of clamping `position` or looping it depending on `size` and `loop` properties.

add.haxe_doc: * Add a keyframe to this track

remove.haxe_doc: * Remove a keyframe from this track

fitSize.haxe_doc: * Update `size` property to make it fit * the index of the last keyframe on this track.

apply.haxe_doc: * Apply changes that this track is responsible of. Usually called after `update(delta)` or `seek(time)`.

findKeyframeBefore.haxe_doc: * Find the keyframe right before or equal to given `position`

findKeyframeAfter.haxe_doc: * Find the keyframe right after given `position`

computeKeyframeBefore.haxe_doc: * Internal. Compute `before` keyframe, if any matching.

computeKeyframeAfter.haxe_doc: * Internal. Compute `after` keyframe, if any matching.

class.haxe_doc: * A track meant to be updated by a timeline. * Base implementation doesn't do much by itself. * Create subclasses to implement details

listensChange.haxe_doc: Does it listen to change event

loop.haxe_doc: * Whether this track should loop or not

keyframes.haxe_doc: * Track keyframes. They should be sorted by frame index in ascending order

field.haxe_doc: * Entity field name this track targets

_dox_event_createKeyframe.haxe_doc: * Used to expand how timeline keyframes are created from raw data (from `Fragment` instances). * Respond to this event by assigning a value to the `result` argument. * @param type Type of the field being modified by the keyframe * @param options Can be used to configure timeline keyframe creation * @param value Value of the keyframe * @param time Time (in seconds) of the keyframe * @param easing Easing of the keyframe * @param existing Existing keyframe instance at the same position/time. Can be reused to prevent new allocation of keyframe instance * @param result The object that will hold the resulting keyframe.

Can be reused to prevent new allocation of keyframe instance * @param result The object that will hold the resulting keyframe.
